 31      Base class for ADCs.

 37 -    def transferFunction(self, voltageValues): 

 38          """ 
 39          Apply the ADC transfer function that converts voltages to ADC points. 
 40   
 41          @param voltageValues: 3xN L{np.ndarray} of input voltages. 
 42          @return: 3xN L{np.ndarray} of quantised output values. 
 43          """ 
 44          pass

 48          """ 
 49          Initiate sampling of sensors. 
 50

 52              function should accept a list of sampled values returned in the 
 53              same order as the sensors where specified in this call. 
 54          @param sensors: List of L{Sensor} objects to sample, in order. 
 55          """ 
 56          pass

 58 -class IdealADC(ADC): 

 59      """ 
 60      An ideal ADC that has no quantisation or delay between samples. 
 61      """

 63 -    def transferFunction(self, voltageValues): 

 64          return voltageValues

 66 -    def startSample(self, callback, *sensors): 

 67          data = [] 
 68          for sensor in sensors: 
 69              data.append(self.transferFunction( 
 70                  sensor.voltages(self.platform.simulation.time))) 
 71   
 72          callback(*data)

 74 -class QuantisingADC(ADC): 

 75      """ 
 76      A quantising ADC with configurable resolution. 
 77   
 78      The ADC has a transfer function given by:: 
 79   
 80                     / -2^(bits-1),                       V < -Vref 
 81        adc points = | floor(V/Vref * 2^(bits-1) + 0.5) - 2^(bits-1) 
 82                     \\ 2^(bits-1) -1                     V >= Vref 
 83      """ 
 84   

 85 -    def __init__(self, platform, bits, vref): 

 86          """ 
 87          @param bits: Resolution of the ADC in output bits 
 88          @param vref: Reference voltage used for voltage conversion 
 89          """ 
 90          ADC.__init__(self, platform) 
 91          self._bits = bits 
 92          self._factor = 2**(bits-1) 
 93          self._vref = vref 

 94   

 95 -    def transferFunction(self, voltageValues): 

 96          return np.clip(np.floor((voltageValues/self._vref) * self._factor + 
 97              0.5) - self._factor, -self._factor , self._factor - 1) 

 98   

 99 -    def startSample(self, callback, *sensors): 

100          data = [] 
101          for sensor in sensors: 
102              data.append(self.transferFunction( 
103                  sensor.voltages(self.platform.simulation.time))) 
104   
105          callback(*data) 

106

129 -        def eventLoop(self):
